revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: (Verso) "Agathokles to Demetrios greetings. You have not done well keeping the harvested grain until now unthreshed, because the water has made the grain damp, as the land is irrigated in that neighbourhood. Hence the rents are put at risk. Having learned that you were in Alexandria, I provided the logeutes with a legal instrument, so that it be threshed by me and I receive my share. Even now take care that not all . . . be inundated. Instruct me clearly what your plan is so that my mind is not in suspense. Otherwise, I will take advantage of the legal instrument.";(Recto): "To Demetrios".

listBibl.bibl: Gagos T - Sijpesteijn PJ, ZPE 100, 72-77, 1994, Pl III.1 -- SB XXII, 15710
